content: Hello community, plz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in crypto

comments.author: Xiongli123
comments.body: Quote from: gmhingoro912 on September 12, 2022, 07:06:59 AMHello community, plz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in cryptoHi! You should know that an investor faces a number of risks, among which the most serious are:- The risk of hacking the wallet, as well as fraud, in which the user himself gives the code that gives access to his cryptocurrency. - The risk of sites where transactions are concluded, including technical failures, as well as deception of exchanges and brokers. - The risk of changing legislation, which can both prohibit the use of cryptocurrencies, and simply bring down quotes.I recommend studying additional information (there is a lot of it on the Internet) before investing serious amounts in cryptocurrency. There are also many experienced people on this forum who will be able to help you with valuable advice. You did the right thing by writing here

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: gmhingoro912 on September 12, 2022, 07:06:59 AMplz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in cryptoI will add to the previous post that this kind of investments are risky, hence you should invest only money you afford to lose or have locked in the investment for long time.In my experience with Bitcoin, while the price did recover sooner or later, there were long periods the price was low and the news were depressing; I expect many did sell in such times and if you are one of those getting easily scared by that you better not invest. Even more, investing in bitcoin makes sense only if you plan to leave your coins untouched for 3, 4 or even 5 years, at least. Of course, financial emergencies tend to occur when Bitcoin price is also far from great. So you have to have a good plan.Adding to this the risks the previous post wrote, it's not easy to invest into Bitcoin.Now... you wrote "crypto". Many Bitcoiners will say that you may want to invest in whatever altcoin. Altcoins are way more risky than Bitcoin and I don't have a good rule for them to see profit. In my experience altcoin investments are a losing scenario on long term. Maybe on short or medium term some got nice profits, but I don't recommend altcoins at all.So, altcoins are a no, and Bitcoin is also something that must be weighted carefully. Then you decide for yourself whether you should invest or not. Good luck!

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: gmhingoro912 on September 12, 2022, 07:06:59 AMHello community, plz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in cryptoInvesting is not easy. Frankly, no matter which way you slice it, there's no 100% safe way to invest money. The best investors in the world do it for a living, and they still make mistakes. So, the most important question is: how much money you can afford to lose? Do you have extra money that you don't need for daily living expenses? If so, it doesn't matter if you can afford $100 per month or $1,000 per month, start small, and increase that amount gradually over time. You have to evaluate your risk tolerance; for example, can you handle high-risk investments? What are your financial goals? When you know what you want to achieve, it is easier to choose your investments wisely. Once you have determined that you can handle the stress of investing (i.e., higher risk), then you should experiment with different strategies and instruments, and find out which ones work best for your goals.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on September 12, 2022, 09:29:36 AMQuote from: gmhingoro912 on September 12, 2022, 07:06:59 AMplz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in cryptoI will add to the previous post that this kind of investments are risky, hence you should invest only money you afford to lose or have locked in the investment for long time.The highly volatile cryptocurrency prices (up and down prices) unexpectedly make the risk of losing even greater. Sometimes you see bullish today, there is no guarantee that bullish conditions can last the next day. For this reason, it is strongly discouraged to use borrowed money for crypto investments. Cold money or money that is ready to lose can make investors a little calmer, they can hold their assets in the long term if the coins they buy are in a bearish phase, this condition will not affect the psychology of investors, investors use money that is ready to lose.Quote from: NeuroticFish on September 12, 2022, 09:29:36 AMIn my experience with Bitcoin, while the price did recover sooner or later, there were long periods the price was low and the news were depressing; I expect many did sell in such times and if you are one of those getting easily scared by that you better not invest. Even more, investing in bitcoin makes sense only if you plan to leave your coins untouched for 3, 4 or even 5 years, at least. Of course, financial emergencies tend to occur when Bitcoin price is also far from great. So you have to have a good plan.For every investor, an investment objective is indispensable. After understanding the investment objectives, it will be very easy to determine the direction of investment. Investors can determine whether the investment plan is for protection against inflation, additional income, or wealth growth. Every investment must contain risks, but investors must know behind every risk there must be profit. Risk and profit go hand in hand, for this reason investors should remain calm even when the market is bearish.Before starting to invest, investors should have backup financial preparations, if the indicators of financial readiness have been met, investors can prepare steps to invest safely. However, if the financial condition has not met the readiness, you should focus on improving it so that it does not interfere with the assets that have been prepared for the long term.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: gmhingoro912 on September 12, 2022, 07:06:59 AMHello community, plz share valuable thoughts about crypto, is crypto safe or not for long time, does i invest full money in cryptoI can't say whether my thoughts are valuable (you decide), but I have them of the following nature. It's not 100% sure that crypto is safe in the long time and that's okay. Nothing can be said 100%. Everywhere there are risks and uncertainties. Crypto has always been considered a risky asset since its inception, against the backdrop of the stock market, for example. Trends change and assets that were considered safe can become risky over time. I recommend taking this into account. Especially if you plan to invest full money in crypto. I think this is not a reasonable decision and it is better to change "full money" to "part of the money". Which part, here I don't undertake to advise you and leave the decision to your conscience. Investing all the money in crypto is fraught with losses and troubles. If the market falls, as it is now, and you urgently need money, then there will be no other way out than to sell crypto at a loss. You were making these purchases for the opposite reasons, weren't you? This means that losses must be avoided at all costs. Or the market will sink even more and with free money, you can buy another crypto at a bargain price. In general, I consider the strategy of buying in parts with some time intervals to be the best.
